intro: Brunellia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered brunellia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, white or pink flowers. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Brunellia pauciflora is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
